The Last of Us 2 represents how games sh: First of all\, for a game to be a 10 on my scale it would have to be something earth shattering amazing that I would play for 100+ hours. I’d say TLOU1 was very close. I’d give it a 9.8. I’d give TLOU2 a 9.3 to be specific. Second\, if you rated this game anything under a 7 you are being ridiculously unfair and you didn’t go into this experience with an open mind\, or you didn’t enjoy the first game\, maybe it’s just not your genre of choice\, but if that were the case you would not have played the second.It’s the same incredible gameplay from the first game\, Naughty Dog didn’t try to fix what wasn’t broken. The story was a lot more ambitious than the first\, with the story/writing being the chief complaint. The first game had a very tight and focused plot. Whereas the first game felt like an interactive movie\, part 2 felt like an interactive TV series. As for the story\, it hit some lulls (TLOU1 never did) and I didn’t particularly enjoy the flashbacks\, but playing the two timelines was so compelling and suspenseful. The first day with Abby I was disappointed to even be playing with her and the first day was a bit boring. Day 2 and 3 with Abby was the highlight of the game though. At the end of the day\, I play games to have fun. I judge them way differently from movies and books. I play video games specifically to have fun. If a game were truly anything under a 6\, there’s just no way I’d have the patience to see through a subpar 20+ campaign to the end. If you played through this whole game and gave it a 5 or a 6\, you’re full of crap. If you have it under a 5\, you’re a troll that isn’t to be taken seriously. It’s very clear what happened to user reviews of this game. If a game has replay-ability its at least a 7. I will absolutely play TLOU II again\, probably several times over the next 5-10 years. It was an extremely fun game\, bottom line. I didn’t want this game to end. But I will say the ending was a bit too dragged out. The part where you’re tracking down Abby was an absolute blast though. So to wrap it up\, no it’s not perfect\, no it’s not good as the first but I wasn’t expecting it to be or demanding it to be. But I have to reiterate how damn good of a game it was and how much fun I had playing it. I feel not even the slightest bit of disappointment.… Expand
